title: How to Remove the Pin Code on Android: 2 Quick Ways + Fixes

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the cog icon on your Android's Home screen. You can also get there by swiping down from the top of the Home screen and tapping the gear icon. To remove the PIN code from your lock screen, you must know the current PIN. If you don't know the PIN, see the troubleshooting section to reset your device.

steps.title: Tap Security.
steps.content: Tap Security . This may also look like Security & privacy . If you don't see this option, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Lock Screen.
steps.content: Tap Lock Screen . You may need to scroll down to find this.

steps.title: Tap Screen lock type.
steps.content: Tap Screen lock type . A new window will open.

steps.title: Enter your current lock screen code.
steps.content: Enter your current lock screen code. This is usually a 4- or 6-digit number, unless you set a longer one.

steps.title: Tap None.
steps.content: Tap None . This will remove the current PIN code on your device. [1] X Research source Keep in mind that having no PIN code will decrease the security on your device, since anyone can access your phone if it's left out. If you'd rather use a different method to lock your phone, select it now. You can use a fingerprint, pattern , or password on most devices. Once you select a new option, follow the on-screen instructions to set it up.

steps.title: Open your Android’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your Android’s Settings. This is the cog icon on your Android's Home screen. You can also get there by swiping down from the top of the Home screen and tapping the gear icon. Use this method to unlock your SIM card when it's password protected.

steps.title: Tap Privacy or Security and privacy.
steps.content: Tap Privacy or Security and privacy . You may have to scroll down to find one of these options. Because all Android models are different, the name of your privacy option may be different. You may need to tap Fingerprints, face data and screen lock first on some Android models.

steps.title: Tap More security settings.
steps.content: Tap More security settings . On some devices, you may see SIM card security under the “SIM Card Lock” header.

steps.title: Select your SIM card.
steps.content: Select your SIM card. This opens your SIM card’s security settings. If the SIM is protected by a PIN, a check mark will appear next to "Lock SIM Card."

steps.title: Tap the switch for "Lock SIM card".
steps.content: Tap the switch for "Lock SIM card". The switch will turn grey. A pop-up will appear.

steps.title: Enter your current PIN and tap OK.
steps.content: Enter your current PIN and tap OK . The PIN is a 4 to 8 digit number. If you don’t know the PIN, you may be able to get it from your mobile provider. If the PIN is accepted, the check mark will disappear from the “Lock SIM Card” box. This means the PIN is now removed. Try not to guess the PIN, as you only have three attempts to get it right. If you enter the PIN incorrectly 3 times, you will be unable to try again, and a new SIM will be required.

steps.title: Try using Find My Device.
steps.content: Try using Find My Device. If you don't know your current PIN, you can try logging into the Find My Device website , setting a new password, and then using that password to unlock your phone. This process may require you to factory reset your Android.

steps.title: Contact your manufacturer or carrier.
steps.content: Contact your manufacturer or carrier. While they may not be able to help you recover your lost PIN number, you may want to give it a try before factory resetting your device.

steps.title: Factory reset the device.
steps.content: Factory reset the device. If you don't have the current PIN and can't access your device, you'll need to factory reset it . Keep in mind that this will erase all images, videos, and other data associated with and on your device. You can reset your phone using its buttons, but this will vary depending on the device. Samsung : Power off the phone. Press and hold the side button, power button, and volume up button at the same time until the device vibrates and the logo appears. Use the volume buttons to select Wipe data/Factory reset . Use the power button to select it. Wait for the factory reset to complete. Select Reboot device . Set up your device again. Google Pixel : Power off the phone. Press and hold the volume down button and power button until you see the logo. Use the volume buttons to select Wipe data/Factory reset . Use the power button to select it. Wait for the factory reset to complete. Select Reboot system now . Set up your device again.
